com.ojcoleman.europa.core

Class Population<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ComponentBase
          • com.ojcoleman.europa.core.Population<G,F>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer, Stringable, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimplePopulation

    public abstract class Population<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>>
extends ComponentBase
implements Observer
    Represents the population of Individuals in the evolutionary algorithm.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • desiredSize

        @Parameter(description="The desired population size.",
           defaultValue="100",
           minimumValue="1")
protected int desiredSize

      • individualPrototype

        @Prototype(description="The configuration for the prototype Individual.",
           defaultClass=Individual.class)
protected Individual<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>> individualPrototype

      • evolver

        @Component(description="Component for creating the initial population and new individuals from existing individuals via genetic operators.",
           defaultClass=DefaultEvolver.class)
protected Evolver<G extends Genotype<?>> evolver

      • speciator

        @Component(description="Optional component for speciating the population.",
           defaultClass=NoSpeciation.class)
protected Speciator<G extends Genotype<?>,Species<G extends Genotype<?>>> speciator

      • ranker

        @Component(description="Component for determining the overall relative fitness of individuals in the population.",
           defaultClass=NSGAII.class)
protected Ranker<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>> ranker

      • species

        protected java.util.List<Species<G extends Genotype<?>>> species
        List of Species associated with this population, in order of oldest to newest.

      • fittest

        protected Individual<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>> fittest
        A reference to the highest ranked individual. Cleared when is called and set when rank() is called.

      • bestPerforming

        protected Individual<G extends Genotype<?>,F extends Function<?,?>> bestPerforming
        A reference to the "best performing" individual. Cleared when is called and set when rank() is called. The performance value used is drawn from the first performance metric defined by the first Evaluator in Run.evaluators which defines a performance metric.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Population

        public Population(ComponentBase parentComponent,
          Configuration componentConfig)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor for ComponentBase.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • getDesiredSize

        public int getDesiredSize()
        Returns the desired or preferred population size. This may differ at times from the size of the Set returned by getMembers() as some individuals may have been removed because they could not be transcribed or evaluated successfully.

      • size

        public abstract int size()
        Return the number of individuals in this Population.

      • getMembers

        public abstract java.util.Collection<Individual<G,F>> getMembers()
        Should return all the members of this population.

      • addIndividual

        public abstract void addIndividual(Individual<G,F> individual)
        Add the given Individual to this population.

      • removeIndividual

        public void removeIndividual(Individual<G,?> ind)
        Remove the given Individual from this population. Also removes the Individual from it's current Species, if set.

      • remove

        protected abstract void remove(Individual<G,?> ind)
        Implementations must remove the given individual from the underlying collection.

      • getIndividual

        public abstract Individual<G,F> getIndividual(long genotypeID)
        Returns the individual with the given ConfigurableBase.id.

      • getFittest

        public Individual<G,F> getFittest()
        Returns a reference to the highest ranked individual. Cleared when is called and set when rank() is called.

      • getBestPerforming

        public Individual<G,F> getBestPerforming()
        Returns a reference to the best performing individual. Cleared when is called and set when rank() is called. The performance value used is drawn from the first performance metric defined by the first Evaluator in Run.evaluators which defines a performance metric.

      • addGenotype

        public void addGenotype(java.lang.Object... genotypeAndOptionalArgs)
        Add the given genotype as an Individual to this population.
        Parameters:
        genotypeAndOptionalArgs - The first argument should be the Genotype of the Individual to add. If a custom class has been set for individualPrototype then more arguments can be supplied that match the constructor of that class.

      • generate

        public void generate()
        Generates and adds Individuals to this Population. getDesiredSize() individuals will be added. A seed Genotype is generated with Transcriber.getTemplateGenotype(), and the genetic material for each individual is created by running Evolver.mutateGenotype(Genotype, boolean) on the seed Genotype.

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate()

        Evaluate all the individuals in this Population with the Evaluators in Run.evaluators. Prior to evaluation an Individual will be Transcriber.transcribe(Genotype, Function)d.

        Individuals are transcribed and evaluated in parallel via Run.parallel.

        Returns:
        true iff any of the Evaluators indicated that the evolutionary run should terminate, false otherwise.

      • getEvoler

        public Evolver<G> getEvoler()
        Returns the Evolver that is used to create new genetic material for this population based on existing members.

      • rank

        public void rank()
        Produces a ranking over this population with Ranker.rank(Population).
        See Also:
        Individual.getRank()

      • speciate

        public void speciate()
        Speciates this population with Speciator#speciate(Population, List>. getSpecies() and #getSpeciesMembers(Species) may be called subsequently.

      • evolve

        public void evolve()
        Performs an evolutionary iteration/generation with Evolver.evolve(Population). In a generational algorithm this will typically replace the "least fit" members of the population with new members based on genetic material from the "most fit".

      • getSpecies

        public java.util.List<Species<G>> getSpecies()
        Returns the Species in this Population.

      • getState

        public java.util.List<ComponentStateLog> getState()
        Description copied from class: ComponentBase
        Sub-classes may override this to provide information (usually simple statistics) about their current state. This is useful for a Monitor or similar that is observing the Component. It is generally a good idea to call the super-method if overriding this method (except for the version defined on ComponentBase itself which does nothing).
        Overrides:
        getState in class ComponentBase

      • eventOccurred

        public void eventOccurred(Observable observed,
                 java.lang.Object event,
                 java.lang.Object state)
        Description copied from interface: Observer
        Called when the subject being observed triggers an event (generally when it has changed state in a significant way).
        Specified by:
        eventOccurred in interface Observer
        Parameters:
        observed - The subject (the object being observed).
        event - An object indicating the type of change or event, this is usually an defined by the Subject. If null is given then the Observer(s) will be passed Observable.Event.Unspecified.
        state - An arbitrary object typically describing the current state of the Observable or information about the event.
